{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient has been breastfed since birth and the regurgitation started 2 weeks ago. The mother has already tried limiting the volume of each feed, which reduced the frequency of the regurgitation. The patient's height and weight are within normal range, and there is no diarrhea, hematochezia, or family history of food allergies. The physical exam shows a healthy infant with normoactive bowel sounds. Therefore, the best next step in management would be to reassurance and counseling on positioning as it is likely that the regurgitation is related to feeding technique rather than any underlying condition.", "answer_choice": "C"}
